actionable.insight: start stuff... then forget what I was doing halfway through. Lose keys. Miss appointments. Say “sorry I’m
do list for 4 hours zoning out while someone’s talking to you feeling like you’re not really “here”...
do that later” about 47 different things... and doing none This is inattentive ADHD . And it’s sneaky.

takeaways: Behind “she’s just a bit away with the fairies
ADHD doesn’t always look like hyper kids and fidgeting Nope
Say “sorry I’m late” more than I said “good morning
My brain wasn’t lazy… it was just overwhelmed Here’s what no one tells you: It’s not that we don’t care
I didn’t know I had ADHD… until I realised I was losing my life to it For years I thought I was lazy
source_title: The surprising truth about inattentive ADHD (that no one tells you)
